subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Lean in Big Companies
description: A quick win: understand Lean in Big Companies.

hook.text: General Electric spent $300 million adopting lean startup methods across the company in 2012.

buildup.text: CEO Jeff Immelt believed GE was too slow. Projects took years and cost millions before customer feedback.

discovery.text: GE trained thousands of managers to run experiments, test assumptions, and kill projects that weren't learning.

twist.text: The culture clash was brutal. Engineers who built jet engines were told to think like scrappy founders.

climax.text: GE's FastWorks program cut product development cycles by 40% and saved hundreds of millions of dollars.

punchline.text: Even a 130-year-old company can learn to think like a startup.

quiz.question: What was the result of GE adopting lean startup methods through its FastWorks program?
options: It failed due to cultural resistance from engineers
Product development cycles were cut by 40%, saving hundreds of millions
GE abandoned the program after one year due to high costs
